title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct answer for y ″

y ″ ( x ) = 2 − k 2 cos ( k x )

1 point is earned for the correct answer for k2 < 2, no POI

If k 2 ≤ 2 , y ″ ≥ 0 for all x, so no inflection points

1 point is earned for the correct answer for k2 = 2, no POI

1 point is earned for the correct answer for k2 > 2, infinitely many POI

1 point is earned for correctly justifying k2 > 2 case with statement that y'' changes sign

If k 2 > 2 , y ″ changes sign and is periodic, so changes sign infinitely many times. Hence there are infinitely many inflection points.

If k 2 > 2 , y ″ changes sign and is periodic, so changes sign infinitely many times. Hence there are infinitely many inflection points.
